description: This is a round glass vessel with two openings, and some copper wire built into it, which creates an electric arc inside it if supplied with electricity.  Could be used for producing nitric acid via Birkeland-Eyde process from air, but this needs a lot of power.

A set of eight test tubes, four small glass flasks and one large glass jar, for use in various chemistry projects.  It should be enough for most things you're likely to do, but some things may need more specialized vessels.
//: Volume assumes that all the smaller glass containers are placed into the large jar for more compact storage.  Currently that is possible to do in-game.  Planned to have CHEM 3 quality; doesn't have it yet because chemistry recipes weren't updated.
//2: Unobtainable for now; needs a crafting recipe and spawn entries, as well as use in recipes.

description: A set of eight test tubes, four small glass flasks and one large glass jar, as well as a large assortment of various more specialized glass vessels, for use in various chemistry projects.  It should have the right vessels for any kind of chemistry project you may want to do.
//: Volume assumes that some of the smaller glass containers are placed into the larger ones for more compact storage.  Currently that is possible to do in-game. Planned to have CHEM 4 quality; doesn't have it yet because chemistry recipes weren't updated.
//2: Unobtainable for now; needs a crafting recipe and spawn entries, as well as use in recipes.

description: A set of assorted small glass pipes which can be connected together, meant for transferring gases between vessels in various chemistry projects.
//: Unobtainable for now; needs crafting recipe and spawn entries, as well as use in recipes.

description: A small bar magnet encased in a layer of glass, meant to be used together with magnetic stirrer for stirring chemical solutions.
A comparatively small electric device intended to produce ice from water.  In a pinch, it can be used to cool down other things as well.

A comparatively small electric device intended to produce ice from water, as well as a large glass jar full of water.  It could be used for making ice baths for chemical reactions that require cooling.
//: Volume assumes that the glass jar of water is stuffed into the ice maker for more compact storage.

description: A portable laboratory magnetic stirrer, with a built-in heating element.  Necessary for some of the more advanced chemical projects and simply useful for most of them, it can also function like a regular hotplate.
An extremely heavy high pressure reactor for conducting chemical reactions that require very high pressure.  It has a built-in electric heating element and an overhead stirrer.
//: Safe for use with pressure of up to 200 bar and temperature up to 250 C.  Anything requring higher pressure or temperature should use purpose-made industrial equipment.  Needs a crafting recipe.

description: A rather large gastight steel vessel with a pipe fitting.  When paired with a vacuum pump, it is useful for conducting some chemical reactions that require a vacuum.

A small handheld lamp powered by a battery that emits ultraviolet light.  Not useful for helping you see better in dark, but could be used for killing bacteria in water to make it safe to drink, creating fluorescent effects, curing inks and resins, phototherapy and suntanning.
A rather large electricity-powered box-shaped device meant to be used for the production of dry ice pellets for cooling, if supplied with carbon dioxide.

A set of pipes and various vessels built to produce vinylacetylene and then chloroprene from acetylene.  It consists of a spiral humidifier, a reactor with built-in electric heater and thermostat, water vessels, drying columns, condenser, and a cryogenic fractional distillation column.
